text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus stewardiana is a species of tree in the beech family. It is widespread across much of China (Anhui, Guangdong, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Sichuan, Yunnan, Zhejiang).Quercus stewardiana is a tree up to 12 meters tall. Twigs are hairless. Leaves can be as much as 12 cm long, green on the top but white and waxy on the underside.
text.External links: line drawing, Flora of China Illustrations vol. 4, fig. 387, drawings 8-10 at lower right
